Posts.Content: Nov 27, 2011 05:57PM - edited Nov 27, 2011 05:58PM by booboo17 Hi Katiebug,  I too was just diagnosed with DCIS.  I had a lumpectomy and was all set to do radiation and tamoxifen.  I have just found out last week that I am BRCA 1 positive.  I'm now struggling with the decision of a mastectomy.  It seems to be the most preventative answer, still very hard to digest!  I'm going for a second opinion this week.  I guess being BRCA positive changes everything and I'm still trying to gather information that justifies that.  I wasn't thinking of a mastectomy until I found out about the gene mutation being positive.  As much as radiation stinks too, I believe it has great results as far as reoccurence.  I feel your overwhelmed state!  I have never cried so much before in my life and I just want to make the right decision!  Good luck to you.
Posts.Title: Such heavy decisions... katiebug msphil
